info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 5:20AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOWFALL FOR THE MORNING COMMUTE IN THE ALBUQUERQUE AND SANTA FE METRO AREAS... An area of light snow will move across the Albuquerque and Santa Fe metro areas through early this morning. A quick dusting to 1" of snow is likely, especially over the East Mountains and within the Albuquerque and Santa Fe foothills. Locally higher amounts up to 2" are possible above 8,000 feet. NMDOT roadway cams indicate low visibility with snowpacked and icy travel along portions of Interstate 40 through Tijeras Canyon, Interstate 25 around Santa Fe, and on State Road 14. Motorists are encouraged to slow down and allow extra time for the morning commute. Snow is expected to end around 10 am. For the latest road conditions visit nmroads.com or dial 5-1-1.
